src.helper_functions.sgl2int module¶

Created on January 26th

@author: Jan Gieseler

A collection of function to map floating point numbers to integers (32 bit) and back needed for sending floating point numbers to Labview FPGA, since the c-compiled FPGA code doesn’t accept floats

test unit: test_sgl2int.py

src.helper_functions.sgl2int.SGL_to_U32(x)¶

converts a floating point number (sgl) into the equivalent 32bit integer :param x: floating point number, i.e. sgl :return: 32 bit integer

src.helper_functions.sgl2int.U32_to_SGL(x)¶

converts a 32bit integer into the equivalent floating point number (sgl) :param x: 32 bit integer :return: floating point number, i.e. sgl

src.helper_functions.sgl2int.bool_2_int(boolean_array)¶
src.helper_functions.sgl2int.exponent_to_bool(x, boolean_array)¶
Parameters:
  • x – exponent that is converted into a boolean array and appended to boolean_array
  • boolean_array – append the boolean are from x to this array
Returns:
src.helper_functions.sgl2int.int_2_bool(x, boolean_array=[], inttype='I8')¶

converts the integer x into the equivalent boolean array of length inttype :param x: integer to be converted :param boolean_array: array to which converted integer array is appended :param inttype: type of integer (determines the length of the boolean array) :return:

src.helper_functions.sgl2int.mantissa_2_bool(x, boolean_array=[])¶
Parameters:
  • x – matissa that is converted into a boolean array and appended to boolean_array
  • boolean_array – append the boolean are from x to this array
Returns:
